trans-unit.source: Represents a set of properties for a message.
This class cannot be inherited.
As a message passes through the channel infrastructure, it passes through a number of logically separate processing entities.

For instance, a message that is part of a reliable messaging stream can potentially pass through a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoder>, a transport-level channel provider, the reliable-messaging channel provider, the streaming channel provider or any channel extensions.
Sometimes these intermediaries annotate the message with the results of that processing by using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties> class.

A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties> instance is an annotation on a message and is stored as a set of name-to-object mappings in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message.Properties%2A> property of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> instance.
The message properties should be cleared out when the user gets the following error:
**The server committed a protocol violation. Section=ResponseBody Detail=Response chunk format is invalid**
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> class with preset properties.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
Adds an element with the specified name and property into the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> collection.
The name of the element to add.
The value of the element to add.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to store this message before giving it to the transport.
`true` if the batching of outgoing messages is allowed; otherwise, `false`.
Removes all elements from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> collection.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> contains a specific name, key, or identifier.
The name, key, or identifier to locate in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
`true` if the contains an element with the specified name; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the content of the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> to this instance.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> object in which to copy from.
Gets the total number of properties in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
The total number of properties in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> class.
Call <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties>.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties> occupied.
Always call <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using are not freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties> object's `Finalize` method.
Gets the encoder that is used to write messages to a stream and to read messages from a stream.
This property specifies a message encoder that can be used to serialize or deserialize the message instance this <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties> instance is attached to.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoder"></xref> that is used to write messages to a stream and to read messages from a stream.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> has a fixed size.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this set of properties is read-only.
`true` if this set of properties is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Retrieves a property with the specified name, identifier, or key value.
The name of the property to get from the collection.
The property with the specified name, or `null` if the property does not exist.
Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains the keys in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains the keys in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
Removes the element with the specified name from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
The name of the element to remove.
`true` if the contains an element with the specified name and can be removed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the security-related property of a message.

HTTP client authentication results are translated into an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.ServiceModelSecurityTokenTypes.SecurityContext%2A>, which is attached to the message using a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty>.
This property can be used by higher layers to implement arbitrary authorization logic.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty"></xref> object.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> contains a specific name, and retrieves its value.
The name of the element to locate.
The value of the found element.
`true` if the contains an element with the specified name; otherwise, `false`.
Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains the values in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains the values in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref>.
Gets or sets the transport address that is used to send messages.
The transport channel owns the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties.Via%2A> property and it overwrites whatever value you set for the message headers.

You do have one opportunity to set the channel's `Via`, which is during the creation of the channel from the channel factory, for example, with <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory%601.CreateChannel%28System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress%2CSystem.Uri%29>.
A URI that contains the transport address that is used to send messages.
Returns an enumerator that can iterate through a collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
